page.title: 08RECREATION (continued)
page.content:
As an area for fell-walking this region is unsurpassed. The Pennine Hills hereabouts are among the last of the real wilderness areas of Britain. There is one important proviso - - be sure to note when the red flags are flying, signifying the danger area
utilised for practice by the armed forces. This applies to some of the moorland to the east and south of the villages, but on certain days access is allowed, with permission. It is best to check with the local tourist office in Appleby.
